alert.note: Alert for McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McCulloch and southern San Saba Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 418 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Sloan, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Chappel, Sloan and Harkeyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
